arm_group.description: Motivational Interviewing integrated with Social Network Counseling, 20-minute session.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this research is to test the feasibility and efficacy of a brief (one
      session) preventative intervention using motivational interviewing integrated with social
      network counseling for substance use among adolescent patients in a primary care setting.
      One hundred participants will be randomly assigned to either motivational interviewing
      integrated with social network counseling or attention control conditions. The motivational
      interviewing integrated with social network counseling condition is expected to show
      improvement when compared to the attention control condition.

clinical_study.brief_title: Motivational Interviewing Integrated With Social Network Counseling for Teens

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  14-18 years old

          -  Resident of Richmond VA or greater Richmond area

          -  Patient at Virginia Commonwealth University or Richmond City Department of Health

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Ward of the state

          -  Not fluent in English

          -  Incapable of providing consent

intervention.description: This is the active arm of the study.

clinical_study.official_title: Motivational Interviewing Integrated With Social Network Counseling for Teens

authority: United States: Data Safety Monitoring Board

primary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of motivational interviewing integrated with social network counseling compared to an attention control condition on substance use factors in teens assessed via self-report questionnaires at baseline, 1, 3, and 6 months.
primary_outcome.measure: Effects of counseling on substance use factors in teens

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
